trans-unit.source:
\n

The exception that is thrown when SQL Server returns a warning or error.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx XXX Xxxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the severity level of the error returned from the .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx .XXX Xxxxxxxxx Xxxx Xxxxxxxx xxx XXX Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A value from 1 to 25 that indicates the severity level of the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxx xxxx 0 xx 00 xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
For more information, see Data Tracing in ADO.NET.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx$ xxx Xxxx Xxxxxxx xx XXX.XXX.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the line number within the Transact-SQL command batch or stored procedure that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx Xxxxxxxx$XXX xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The line number within the Transact-SQL command batch or stored procedure that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx Xxxxxxxx$XXX xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a number that identifies the type of error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number that identifies the type of error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the stored procedure or remote procedure call (RPC) that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx $XXX$ xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the stored procedure or RPC.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx XXX.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the computer that is running an instance of SQL Server that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the computer running an instance of SQL Server.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the provider that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the provider that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x
